headline.main: U.S. Attacks Drug Suppliers But Loses Battle of the Users

byline.original: By PHILIP M. BOFFEY, Special to the New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The Federal Government's programs to control drug abuse are failing because they emphasize a futile crackdown on suppliers while neglecting the more important task of weaning the American public from its habits, according to a range of experts in the drug fight.
